p: NF-κB and AP-1 also directly regulate HO-1 expression as transcription factors. Unlike evolutionary conserved Nrf2-HO-1 regulation, the HO-1 regulation by NF-κB and AP-1 is dependent on lipopolysaccharide (LPS), a prototypical Toll-like receptor 4 (TLR4) agonist [ 77]. Once TLR4 is stimulated by LPS or monophosphoryl lipid A, another synthetic TLR4 agonist, it activates NF-κB [ 78, 79] and AP-1 [ 80]. Inhibition of the NF-κB pathway with small molecules suppressed LPS-induced HO-1 promoter activity [ 77]. AP-1 homodimers or heterodimers bind to enhancers of the promoter region of hmox1 [ 81]. The expression of HO-1 requires AP-1 activation by LPS [ 80].
